title: Logistics & Compliance Coordinator
description: Providing Compliant security operatives, Export / Import licensing, tailored specific requirements, mitigating the risks to people and Property. Responsibilities Responsible for the management and development of over 50 Indian & Pilipino personnel ensuring they are compliant within maritime industry standards and client requirements. Managing the Export license documentation SIELS, OITCLS, OIEL's Competent user of SPIRE knowledge of section 5 goods, BIS & Understanding of US Regulations Responsible for maintaining the Export control database Deputise in the procurement of licensed weapons and munitions Regular liaison with munitions suppliers, in country agents and other government departments to ensure smooth transition of licensed dual purpose strategic goods Managed all operational aspects in the provision of maritime security services to vessel operators including documentary procedures to facilitate enhanced service delivery e.g. Flag State approval, OK to board documents (OK2B), visa issue and Letters of Invitation for personnel as required depending on individual country legislation. Coordinating all aspects of the logistical storage, movement and record keeping of weapons and equipment worldwide. Communicates on a daily basis with overseas shipping agents, Masters of vessels and contractors to ensure timely embarkation and disembarkation of personnel. Managed travel arrangements for personnel deploying worldwide taking into considerations costs, accommodation and arrival/departure deadlines. Consistently improving relations with Agents/port authorities in Egypt, Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Djibouti, Sudan, Sri Lanka, Oman, UAE, India, South Africa, East Africa and Madagascar Maintaining and complying with ISO 9001/ ISO 28007 standards
headquarters:

name: Stephen Booker

title: Maritime Operations Coordinator
description: Specialist Maritime Intelligence, Risk forecasting & Mitigation advice to mariners and associated personnel. Act as part of the 24/7 team for Dryad’s operational support, managing clients in receipt of the company’s operational intelligence support. Maintain the Common Operations Plot (COP) and track all shipping clients in receipt of Dryad's maritime operations services. Compile and coordinate the distribution of maritime operations products to clients, contributing to the global assessment of all maritime risks, informing clients via the alert messages/warnings and other products. React to and advise on all client requirements, issues and incidents by the most expedient communication media as events occur; compile and distribute products to mitigate the risk of immediate or emerging threats to the Safety of Life At Sea (SOLAS), informing duty staff as appropriate. Developing and maintaining good relationships with ships’ masters, their crews and any supporting elements. Liaise with the wider Ops Team for the provision of products and services, advising clients of prospective delivery times and service initiation. Maintain accurate auditable records of communications with clients, including a record of vessel planed passage waypoints and proposed routes. Respond to short notice request for clients joining and leaving outside of routine business hours, to provide cover and continuity for Operations day staff.
